greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least nonnegative integer m such that there are nonnegative integers x,y,z,w for which x^2 + y^2 + z^2 + w^2 = n and x + 3*y + 5*z = m^2.
comment: Clearly, a(n) = 0 if n is a square. Part (i) of the conjecture in A271518 implies that a(n) always exists.
For more conjectural refinements of Lagrange's four-square theorem, one may consult arXiv:1604.06723.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Refining Lagrange's four-square theorem, arXiv:1604.06723 [math.GM], 2016.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, May 19 2016
